<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 11"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Accompaniment Cloak](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2318)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Focused" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=74" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Occult" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=120" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 147 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 1,300 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn cloak

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This lush velvet capelet is embroidered with images of musicians playing a wide variety of instruments. The images animate when you make art, remaining embroidered, but smoothly unknitting and reknitting in time with your performance. The figures play music that perfectly accompanies your instrument, voice, or movements, granting you a +2 item bonus to [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) checks.

**Activate** <actions string="Free Action" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561)) **Frequency** once per day;   **Effect** You gain 1 Focus Point, which you can use only to cast a bard [composition](/Traits.aspx?ID=31) spell. If not used by the end of your turn, this Focus Point is lost.

**Activate** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561), [manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=645)) **Frequency** once per day;   **Effect** You peel the musicians from the garment and fling them around you. The cloak casts a 4th-rank [_phantom crowd_](/Spells.aspx?ID=968) spell (DC 28); each of the 10-foot squares must be adjacent to you. The crowd looks like the musicians on the garment and continues to accompany your Performance checks. You can Sustain this effect as described in the spell.

**Craft Requirements** You are a [bard](/Classes.aspx?ID=3).

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Accompaniment Cloak
